verses.verse: Would <WG3785> to God you could bear <WG430> with me a little <WG3397> in my folly: <WG877> and indeed <WG235> bear <WG430> with me.

For I am jealous <WG2206> over you with godly <WG2596> <WG2316> jealousy: <WG2205> for I have espoused <WG718> you to one <WG1520> husband, <WG435> that I may present <WG3936> you as a chaste <WG53> virgin <WG3933> to Christ. <WG5547>

But I fear, <WG5399> lest <WG3381> by any <WG3381> means, <WG4458> as the serpent <WG3789> beguiled <WG1818> Eve <WG2096> through <WG1722> his subtlety, <WG3834> so <WG3779> your <WG5216> minds <WG3540> should be corrupted <WG5351> from the simplicity <WG572> that is in Christ. <WG5547>

For if <WG1487> he that comes <WG2064> preaches <WG2784> another <WG243> Jesus, <WG2424> whom <WG3739> we have not preached, <WG2784> or <WG2228> if you receive <WG2983> another <WG2087> spirit, <WG4151> which <WG3739> you have not received, <WG2983> or <WG2228> another <WG2087> gospel, <WG2098> which you have not accepted, <WG1209> you might well <WG2573> bear <WG430> with him.
For I suppose <WG3049> I was not a whit <WG3367> behind <WG5302> the very <WG5228> most chief <WG5228> <WG3029> apostles. <WG652>

But though <WG1499> I be rude <WG2399> in speech, <WG3056> yet <WG235> not in knowledge; <WG1108> but we have been thoroughly <WG1722> <WG3956> made <WG5319> manifest <WG5319> among <WG1519> you in all <WG3956> things.

Have I committed <WG4160> an offense <WG266> in abasing <WG5013> myself <WG1683> that you might be exalted, <WG5312> because <WG3754> I have preached <WG2097> to you the gospel <WG2098> of God <WG2316> freely? <WG1432>
I robbed <WG4813> other <WG243> churches, <WG1577> taking <WG2983> wages <WG3800> of them, to do you service. <WG1248>

And when I was present <WG3918> with you, and wanted, <WG5302> I was chargeable <WG2655> to no <WG3762> man: <WG3762> for that which was lacking <WG5303> to me the brothers <WG80> which came <WG2064> from Macedonia <WG3109> supplied: <WG4322> and in all <WG3956> things I have kept <WG5083> myself <WG1683> from being burdensome <WG4> to you, and so will I keep <WG5083> myself. <WG1683>
As the truth <WG225> of Christ <WG5547> is in me, no <WG3756> <WG3762> man shall stop <WG5420> me of this <WG3778> boasting <WG2746> in the regions <WG2824> of Achaia. <WG882>
Why? <WG1302> because <WG3754> I love <WG25> you not? God <WG2316> knows. <WG1492>

But what <WG3739> I do, <WG4160> that I will do, <WG4160> that I may cut <WG1581> off <WG1581> occasion <WG874> from them which desire <WG2309> occasion; <WG874> that wherein <WG1722> <WG3757> they glory, <WG2744> they may be found <WG2147> even <WG2532> as we.
For such <WG5108> are false <WG5570> apostles, <WG5570> deceitful <WG1386> workers, <WG2040> transforming <WG3345> themselves into <WG1519> the apostles <WG652> of Christ. <WG5547>
And no <WG3762> marvel; <WG2298> for Satan <WG4567> himself <WG846> is transformed <WG3345> into <WG1519> an angel <WG32> of light. <WG5457>

Therefore <WG3767> it is no <WG3762> great <WG3173> thing if <WG1499> his ministers <WG1249> also <WG2532> be transformed <WG3345> as the ministers <WG1249> of righteousness; <WG1343> whose <WG3739> end <WG5056> shall be according <WG2596> to their works. <WG2041>

I say <WG3004> again, <WG3825> Let no <WG3367> man <WG5100> think <WG1380> me a fool; <WG878> if <WG1490> otherwise, <WG1490> yet <WG2579> as a fool <WG878> receive <WG1209> me, that I may boast <WG2744> myself a little. <WG3397>
That which <WG3739> I speak, <WG2980> I speak <WG2980> it not after <WG2596> the Lord, <WG2962> but as it were foolishly, <WG1722> <WG877> in this <WG5026> confidence <WG5287> of boasting. <WG2746>
Seeing <WG1893> that many <WG4183> glory <WG2744> after <WG2596> the flesh, <WG4561> I will glory <WG2744> also. <WG2504>
For you suffer <WG430> fools <WG878> gladly, <WG2234> seeing you yourselves are wise. <WG5429>

For you suffer, <WG430> if <WG1487> a man <WG5100> bring <WG2615> you into bondage, <WG2615> if <WG1487> a man <WG5100> devour <WG2719> you, if <WG1487> a man <WG5100> take <WG2983> of you, if <WG1487> a man <WG5100> exalt <WG1869> himself, if <WG1487> a man <WG5100> smite <WG1194> you on <WG1519> the face. <WG4383>

I speak <WG3004> as concerning <WG2596> reproach, <WG819> as though <WG3754> we had been weak. <WG770> However, when ever <WG1722> <WG3739> <WG302> any <WG5100> is bold, <WG5111> (I speak <WG3004> foolishly, <WG1722> <WG877>) I am bold also. <WG5111> <WG2504>
Are they Hebrews? <WG1445> so <WG2504> am I. Are they Israelites? <WG2475> so <WG2504> am I. Are they the seed <WG4690> of Abraham? <WG11> so <WG2504> am I.

Are they ministers <WG1249> of Christ? <WG5547> (I speak <WG2980> as a fool) <WG3912> I am more; <WG5228> in labors <WG2873> more <WG4056> abundant, <WG4056> in stripes <WG4127> above <WG5234> measure, <WG5234> in prisons <WG5438> more <WG4056> frequent, <WG4056> in deaths <WG2288> oft. <WG4178>
Of the Jews <WG2453> five <WG3999> times <WG3999> received <WG2983> I forty <WG5062> stripes save <WG3844> one. <WG3391>

Thrice <WG5151> was I beaten <WG4463> with rods, <WG4463> once <WG530> was I stoned, <WG3034> thrice <WG5151> I suffered shipwreck, <WG3489> a night <WG3574> and a day <WG3574> I have been <WG4160> in the deep; <WG1037>

In journeys <WG3597> often, <WG3740> in perils <WG2794> of waters, <WG4215> in perils <WG2794> of robbers, <WG3027> in perils <WG2794> by my own countrymen, <WG1085> in perils <WG2794> by the heathen, <WG1484> in perils <WG2794> in the city, <WG4172> in perils <WG2794> in the wilderness, <WG2047> in perils <WG2794> in the sea, <WG2281> in perils <WG2794> among <WG1722> false <WG5569> brothers; <WG5569>

In weariness <WG2873> and painfulness, <WG3449> in watchings <WG70> often, <WG3740> in hunger <WG3042> and thirst, <WG1373> in fastings <WG3521> often, <WG3740> in cold <WG5592> and nakedness. <WG1132>
Beside <WG5565> those <WG3588> things that are without, <WG3924> that which <WG3588> comes <WG1999> on me daily, <WG2596> <WG2250> the care <WG3308> of all <WG3956> the churches. <WG1577>
Who <WG5101> is weak, <WG770> and I am not weak? <WG770> who <WG5101> is offended, <WG4624> and I burn <WG4448> not?
If <WG1487> I must <WG1163> needs glory, <WG2744> I will glory <WG2744> of the things which concern <WG4012> my <WG3450> infirmities. <WG769>
The God <WG2316> and Father <WG3962> of our Lord <WG2962> Jesus <WG2424> Christ, <WG5547> which <WG3588> is blessed <WG2128> for ever more, <WG1519> <WG165> knows <WG1492> that I lie <WG5574> not.

In Damascus <WG1154> the governor <WG1481> under Aretas <WG702> the king <WG935> kept <WG5432> the city <WG4172> of the Damascenes <WG1153> with a garrison, <WG5432> desirous <WG2309> to apprehend <WG4084> me:
And through <WG1223> a window <WG2376> in a basket <WG4553> was I let <WG5465> down <WG5465> by the wall, <WG5038> and escaped <WG1628> his hands. <WG5495>
